Title:
A new species of Dacrymyces (Dacrymycetales, Basidiomycota)
from southwestern China
Abstract:
A new species from southwestern China, Dacrymyces
sinostenosporus, is described based on morphological and molecular
evidence. The new species is characterized by sessile, gelatinous, light
honey-yellow to orange yellow, pulvinate to discoid, applanate,
sometimes cerebriform basidioma, cylindrical to clavate probasidia
measuring 40.060.0 × 4.09.0 µm, and hyaline, cylindrical or less
reniform, 7-septate mature basidiospores measuring (17.0)18.023.5(24.0)
× (5.9)6.38.0(8.4) μm. Phylogenetically, the new species forms a
distinct lineage closely related to D. stenosporus based on the ITS +
nLSU dataset, but D. stenosporus has shorter probasidia (3040 × 4 μm)
and smaller 3-septate mature basidiospores (1317 × 56 μm).
